title._content: ["The Elms," Edward Julius Berwind house, 367 Bellevue Avenue, Newport, Rhode Island. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["The Elms," Edward Julius Berwind house, 367 Bellevue Avenue, Newport, Rhode Island. Fountain Alley] [1914 summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Horace Trumbaurer, 1899-1901, 1911. Landscape: Horace Trumbauer, 1907-1914. Gardener: Bruce Butterton. Today: Open to the public as a house and garden museum by the Preservation Society of Newport County. On slide (handwritten): "B" and "Berwind, E.J., Newport." Also, Johnston no. "2776." And, gold star sticker. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 2. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16728 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 1
